link_type.title: The type of data linking task - `dedupe_only`, `link_only` or `link_and_dedupe`.  Required.

proportion_of_matches.title: The proportion of comparisons thought to be matches
proportion_of_matches.description: This provides the initial value (prior) that EM algorithm will start iterating from

em_convergence.title: Convergence tolerance for the EM algorithm.
em_convergence.description: The algorithm will stop converging when the maximum of the change in model parameters between iterations is below this value.

max_iterations.title: The maximum number of iterations to run even if convergence has not been reached

unique_id_column_name.title: The name of the column in the input dataset representing a unique id. For linking tasks, ids must be unique to each dataset being linked, and do not need to be globally unique across these two datasets

comparison_columns.title: A list of columns to use for probabalistic matching
comparison_columns.description: Comparisons between the values in these columns will be used to determine match scores

items.title: A column that is used for probabalistic matching

col_name.title: The name of the column in the input dataset

num_levels.title: The number of different similarity categories that will be computed for this column i.e. the granularity of similarity comparison for the column
num_levels.description: By default, for a string variable, two levels would implies level 0: no match, level 1: almost exact match.  Three levels imples level 0: no match, level 1: strings are similar but not exactly the same, level 2: strings are almost exactly the same.

data_type.title: The data type of the column.  This is used to choose how similarity is assessed this column i.e. which SQL SELECT CASE statement to use.  This is ignored if you explicitly provide a case_expression.

case_expression.title: A SELECT CASE expression that compares the values of the input column and returns integer values corresponding to num_levels.
case_expression.description: This is an override which allows the user to cusomise how similarity is computed for this column.  If given, this overrides the default mechanism of comparing columns and ignores data_type
examples: CASE WHEN first_name_l = first_name_r THEN 1 ELSE 0 END

CASE 
 WHEN jaro_winkler_sim(first_name_l, first_name_r) < 0.94 THEN 2 
 WHEN jaro_winkler_sim(first_name_l, first_name_r) < 0.8 THEN 1 
  ELSE 0 END

m_probabilities.title: A array of the m probabilities for this column i.e. the probability of observing each similarity value amonst matches. There will be num_levels values in this array.
m_probabilities.description: The first probability given corresponds to level 0: least similar.  It refers to the probability of observing level 0 in the comparison vector amongst matches.  The second probability corresponds to level 1, up to level n, most similar.

u_probabilities.title: A array of the u probabilities for this column i.e. the probability of observing each similarity value amonst non-matches. There will be num_levels values in this array.
u_probabilities.description: The first probability given corresponds to level 0: least similar.  It refers to the probability of observing level 0 in the comparison vector amongst matches.  The second probability corresponds to level 1, up to level n, most similar.

term_frequency_adjustments.description: Whether ex post term frequency adjustments should be made to match scores for this column

gamma_index.description: Gamma values in the comparison vector will be put in columns called gamma_0, gamma_1 etc.  This is the gamma index corresponding to this column

blocking_rules.title: A list of one or more blocking rules to apply. Not needed if cartesian_product=true is set
blocking_rules.description: Each rule is a SQL expression represeting the ON clause in a join

items.title: Each item in the array is a SQL expression represing a left join ON condition

cartesian_product.title: If set to true, all comparisons between the input datasets will be generated
cartesian_product.description: For large input datasets, the will generally be computationally intractable because it will generate numrows squared comparisons

additional_columns_to_retain.title: A list of columns not being used in the probabalistic matching comparisons that you want to include in your results.

items.title: Individual strings representing other columns to retain
